Chattel.definition: an item of tangible or intangible personal property ;esp
Chattel.origin: [Old French chatel goods, property, from Medieval Latin capitale , from neuter of capitalis chief, principal see capital ]

chattels personal.definition: an item of tangible movable personal property (as livestock or an automobile) that is not permanently connected with real estate

chattels real.definition: an interest (as a leasehold or profit a prendre) in an item of immovable property (as land or a building) that is less than a freehold estate compare
chattels real.note: Interests that are considered chattels real have been treated by the common law as personal property despite being interests in real property.
